text: Henry Cabot Lodge (May 12, 1850 November 9, 1924) was an American Republican politician, historian, and statesman. He was a member of the United States Senate from 1893 to 1924. He was a critic of the League of Nations. ==Notes== ==References== Category:1850 births Category:1924 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:United States senators from Massachusetts Category:Majority leaders of the United States Senate Category:United States representatives from Massachusetts Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Presidents pro tempore of the United States Senate
title: Henry Cabot Lodge
